name: Iberostar Creta Marine

reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Creta Marine. It was a great hotel for a family. It was clean and the staff were very friendly. The food was good, too good!! Rooms a good size, shower a little temperamental but always hot water. How this hotel would rate in high season and full to capacity I wouldn't like to say but there always sun beds available around the resort whilst we were there. The cliental was mainly French and German but that certainly wasn't a problem for us, in fact it was quite refreshing. Most people where on all inclusive, we opted for H/B which suited us as we visited near by friends for lunch/dinner during our stay but I have to say it didn't have that A/I feel to it, nobody over indulging, and with waiter service, no people queuing at the beer pump!! If your looking for an action packed resort then this will not be for you. They have some evening entertainment and the staff are trying very hard to please, especially with the children. The nearest village is about a 40 minute walk away, so you would need to take a taxi to it or to get further afield. I felt that a week was about just right for us, two and I may have gone a little stir crazy. If your thinking of booking independently as we did it is certainly worth considering, I booked direct for 8 nights, 2 adults 1 child in double garden room at is cost 642 euro for all of us, incredible value. Will definitely be returning.
reviews.title: Lovely Family Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first visit to Crete and after arriving on an overcast day with very few people about we began to doubt if this was such a good choice of hotel - but how wrong we were!
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: The Creta Marine was a wonderful hotel and we had a lovely week, helped by wall-to-wall sunshine.
reviews.title: Paradise on a Greek island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a bungalow with sea view balcony, freshly decorated and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bottle of wine and treats welcomed us on arrival, plus there was a complimentary mini bar in the room for all-inclusive guests.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic holiday and a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok so let's get this place into perspective. Having spent a week in a small family run hotel in the old town of Rethymnon, perfectly situated amongst all you need we then took week two of our holiday a 20 minute drive around the coast to Iberostar creta Marine. We had booked Half Board. Met with a good welcome and room ready to move into things got off to a good start. Within the hour we were sat by the "entertainment pool", 20 mins later the music came on.. Very loud and not comfortable. Off we headed to a smaller pool which was much calmer. Don't get me wrong I'm 38 years of age and like a beer and a giggle but it was a bit over the top. Staff are friendly and good with the children, rooms nice and clean although be careful if you expect a Bungalow to be single story. We booked one but found it had a room above, we questioned this but informed we were in the correct room......so not a Bungalow. Swimming pools are salt water, can sting the eyes a little especially of the children. Creta marine Iberostar is situated right next door to the sister hotel Creta Panorama. The grounds are lovely and blend from one to another. Unfortunately for us we were placed in a room (with nice pool view) that seemed to belong to the Panorama. We felt like guests at another hotels pool when sat with our hotel issue towels which were blue unlike all the others that were yellow. The main block of our hotel including restaurant was actually further away than the other hotel......weird. The food was average, big choice so something for everyone but not excellent as I keep reading which is one of the reasons I'm writing my first ever review. We were also surprised to see we had to pay for Beach sun loungers on a hotel owned beach. Four euros each. Also twenty four euros a week for a safety deposit box to keep our valuables safe in their hotel. Wifi five euros per day!!!. Considering in our previous week at Mythos Suites Hotel in Rethymnon all this was free it is obvious that Iberostar now put more emphasis on profit making than customer service. You can get a shuttle for four euros return to the local village of Panormos which is lovely. Get yourself a table at one of the beach front restaurants and watch the sun go down. All in all we had a great holiday in Rethymnon, but would advise people of the isolation of this hotel and suggest visiting the island but keeping options open when choosing accommodation.
reviews.title: DEPENDS WHAT YOUR LOOKING FOR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do do do visit the old old town of Rethymnon but be careful if eating, you will find food on the Venetian harbour is more expensive and not as good as it is a street or two behind. Basically you pay for the view!!
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall rating out of 10
reviews.title: Would defintely recommend

reviews.text: Rethymnon overall 9
reviews.title: A week in heaven!

reviews.text: Mythos suites 9
reviews.title: Janis

reviews.text: We spent 12 days in the hotel in July with our 2 kids. The hotel organisation is very professional (reception, cleaning, animation and mini club teams). We had no bad point to mention except the lack free places at the swimming pools and on the beach to the fact that people book them early in the morning with their towel. Very good experience with the mini club team who are just perfect with kids (and French speaking). Animation team was frendly but not to invasive and the shows in evenings were of very good level. The variety and quality food was more than one would expect and we had no problem to find a place in the big restaurant (with a beatiful terrace). Free tennis courts if we are all inclusive and you can borrow raquettes and balls.
reviews.title: Good experience with kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend it if you are looking for an all inclusive hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 week in July. The hotel is not near anything so you will need a car. It is about 1 hour drive from either airport and to hire a car for a week is roughly the same as getting a taxi.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: The hotel and grounds are very nice staff are also very nice there is no real beach to speak of it is man made and quite small.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is good lots of variety and the drinks are fine.
reviews.title: beware if you have a mobility problem

reviews.text: We stayed here 21st Aug until 29th Aug 2012 , myself husband and 11 year old daughter, arrived via ferry from Santorini . Booked direct with Thomas cook for All inc 8 nights £800 for the 3 of us which we thought was quite a bargain. Hotel is very clean , staff constantly cleaning and floor washing almost becomes irritating as every morning seem to wash the floor as you walk up to breakfast . We had upgraded our booking to a seafront bungalow it was lovely fab view , but don't expect a huge space it wasnt large by any means, however I think there are suites which would no doubt have more space.
reviews.title: A mixed bag !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - breakfast - this was best meal for me , lots of choice, eggs all styles , omlettes , toasties , pancakes waffles , cereals , breads , salads , cold meats and fruits
reviews.title: not perfect but great all round
Good standard of hotel but very disappointing in some areas
reviews.text: Lunch - pastas, meats and salads - lots of bread and desserts , dinner very similar to lunch - we did find dinner rather repetitive and certainly far too much pork ! we tried the mexican that was a change well a change of scenery unfortunately pork again ! but still worth it for something different.
As said above room fab , cleaned well and reasonably new decor.
reviews.title: Wondeful stay in Crete

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinks - good , wine and beer good , branded spirits bombay saphire , Jack daniels so we were pleased ! my daughter doesnt like fizzy drinks so she struggled a bit only water and juices which werent the best ie not fresh ! we didnt manage to get any milk shakes which she would have loved !
reviews.title: Good hotel if you are looking for a decent resort holiday

description: Quiet prime location, overlooks three coves owned by the hotel. Near to the ethnic town of Panormo. Elegant atmosphere. Water sports galore. Relaxing nature.
